newsitem.title: USA: Group says USDA not focusing on pig, Mad Cow link.
newsitem.headline: Group says USDA not focusing on pig, Mad Cow link.

text.p: The Agriculture Department and the Food and Drug Administration have overlooked pigs as a relevant health hazard and whether concerns about the so-called Mad Cow disease also apply to hogs, said the Government Accountability Project, an advocate group for government whistleblowers.

The group will hold a press briefing Thursday to present a previously unreleased 1979 USDA study of diseased pigs that it says has implications for the safety of U.S. swine and other livestock from diseases similar to the British Mad Cow disease.
The group said that although USDA has been aware of the dormant study and its relevance for nearly a year, it has not acted on it. USDA officials would not comment on the allegations.
It also said that FDA policy overlooks pigs as a relevant hazard.
